decks.notes: The main focus of this deck is to efficiently summon creatures from the deck that can synergize with each other and create powerful combos. The deck utilizes various toolbox creatures like Yawgmoth, Thran Physician and Hapatra, Vizier of Poisons to control the board and generate value. The deck also incorporates cards like Agatha's Soul Cauldron and Malevolent Rumble to disrupt the opponent's game plan. The mana base is designed to support the diverse range of creatures and spells in the deck, allowing for flexibility in gameplay and strategic decision-making.

The deck focuses on quickly ramping mana through lands and artifacts to power out big threat creatures like Primeval Titan. The key strategy is to utilize cards like Amulet of Vigor and Urza's Saga to create explosive turns where multiple lands can be played in a single turn, enabling the combo potential of the deck to win the game quickly. The deck also includes tools like Malevolent Rumble and Scapeshift to control the board and disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up for the combo finish.

This deck focuses on quickly ramping up mana and resources to pull off a game-winning combo involving Allosaurus Rider and Neoform or Eldritch Evolution to bring out powerful creatures like Ghalta, Stampede Tyrant or Griselbrand. The deck also includes cards like Generous Gift and Planar Genesis to control the board and generate advantage. The strategy revolves around efficiently tutoring for key pieces and quickly assembling the combo to overwhelm the opponent. With a mix of ramp, control, and combo pieces, this deck aims to win the game quickly and decisively.

This deck focuses on quickly assembling a board presence and aggressively attacking the opponent using low-cost and efficient creatures and spells. The key strategy is to deal damage as quickly as possible, utilizing cards like Dragon's Rage Channeler, Monastery Swiftspear, and Lightning Bolt to push through damage while using cards like Mishra's Bauble and Expressive Iteration to dig for more threats. The deck aims to maintain pressure on the opponent and close out games before they have a chance to stabilize.

This deck focuses on quickly deploying cheap artifacts and building a board presence to overwhelm the opponent with aggressive threats. By utilizing cards that generate mana and provide card advantage, the deck can consistently play multiple threats per turn and apply pressure to the opponent's life total. With a mix of artifact creatures, equipment, and disruption spells, the deck aims to establish a strong board presence while disrupting the opponent's game plan. By combining speed and versatility, the deck aims to win the game quickly before the opponent can stabilize.

The primary strategy of this deck is to use the powerful land ramp ability of Amulet of Vigor to quickly generate a large amount of mana and play Primeval Titan to search for utility lands. With the combination of Amulet of Vigor, Primeval Titan, and various land search spells like Green Sun's Zenith and Scapeshift, the deck aims to produce overwhelming board presence and mana advantage to overwhelm the opponent in a fast and efficient manner. The deck also includes control elements like Malevolent Rumble and Aftermath Analyst to disrupt the opponent's game plan while setting up its own win condition.

The deck focuses on using powerful instants like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate to quickly reanimate powerful creatures like Atraxa, Grand Unifier or Griselbrand. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Thoughtseize and Force of Negation to protect the combo. The mana base is constructed to support the deck's game plan, with fetch lands to ensure color fixing and access to the necessary mana for the combo. The combination of reanimation spells and disruptive elements allows the deck to quickly assemble its combo and overwhelm the opponent.

This UW Control deck focuses on controlling the game through countering spells, board wipes, and card advantage with Planeswalkers like Teferi and Narset. It also utilizes removal spells like Prismatic Ending and Solitude to deal with threats. The deck has a toolbox feel with cards like Isochron Scepter and Consult the Star Charts for flexibility, while also including powerful finishers like LÃ³rien Revealed and March of Otherworldly Light to close out the game. The mana base is designed to support the deck's control elements while also providing consistency in casting spells.

This deck focuses on aggressive creatures and burn spells to quickly overwhelm the opponent and deal damage efficiently. With a mix of powerful creatures like Ragavan and Scion of Draco, alongside removal like Lightning Bolt and Leyline Binding, the deck aims to control the board while dealing consistent damage. The inclusion of Leyline of the Guildpact and Leyline of Binding helps to support the aggro strategy by providing additional support and protection for your creatures. By maintaining pressure and control, this deck is designed to outpace and outlast the opponent in a fast-paced Modern 1 vs 1 match.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize aggressive creatures and disruptive spells to control the game and disrupt the opponent's strategy. By combining efficient creatures like Phelia, Exuberant Shepherd and powerful enchantments like Witch Enchanter, the deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent while controlling the board with cards like Teferi, Time Raveler and Solitude. The deck also includes cards like Ephemerate and Consign to Memory for additional flexibility and disruption. Overall, the deck focuses on quick, aggressive plays while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

The main idea of this deck is to control the opponent's resources and disrupt their game plan while gradually building up card advantage and applying pressure with efficient threats. The deck focuses on controlling the game through counterspells, removal spells, and hand disruption, while also utilizing powerful creatures like Murktide Regent and Kaito, Bane of Nightmares to close out the game. The mana base is built to support the deck's color requirements and to maximize consistency in casting spells. Overall, the deck aims to outlast the opponent and grind out a victory through resource management and strategic plays.

The deck focuses on ramping up quickly using cards like Sowing Mycospawn and Eldrazi Temple to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Emrakul, the Promised End. It also includes control elements like Kozilek's Command and Ugin, Eye of the Storms to disrupt the opponent's strategy. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with big threats while maintaining control of the game through removal spells and disruptive creatures. With a mix of ramp, control, and powerful finishers, this deck looks to outvalue and outlast the opponent in a 1 vs 1 Modern format.

This deck focuses on quickly reanimating powerful creatures such as Griselbrand using cards like Goryo's Vengeance and Ephemerate. It aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Negation and Thoughtseize, while also controlling the board with cards like Solitude and Prismatic Ending. Atraxa, Grand Unifier provides additional support for the deck, while cards like Psychic Frog and Quantum Riddler help with card advantage and filtering. Teferi, Time Raveler offers additional disruption and protection for the combo. The mana base is designed to support all the different colors needed for the deck.

This deck focuses on ramping up mana quickly with Urza lands to play powerful Eldrazi creatures and planeswalkers that can control the game. It uses cards like Expedition Map and Mind Stone to search for lands and generate extra mana, while also using Karn, the Great Creator to shut down opponent's strategies. Thought-Knot Seer and Devourer of Destiny provide disruption for the opponent's hand while Glaring Fleshraker and Sire of Seven Deaths offer powerful threats on the battlefield. The deck aims to control the game and ultimately overwhelm the opponent with its big creatures and planeswalker abilities.

The key concept of this deck is to control the game through the use of powerful creatures and spells, while also utilizing the UrzaTron lands to ramp up mana quickly. By deploying threats like Karn, the Great Creator and Ugin, the Eye of the Storms, as well as disruptive cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Dismember, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy and dominate the battlefield. With a focus on efficiently generating mana and utilizing Eldrazi creatures, this deck aims to overwhelm the opponent and secure victory through powerful plays and strategic decision-making.

The main concept of this Modern 1 vs 1 Control - UrzaTron deck is to ramp up mana quickly using the Urza lands (Urza's Mine, Urza's Power Plant, Urza's Tower) and Expedition Map, enabling the player to cast powerful Eldrazi creatures and devastating colorless spells. The deck aims to control the game through disruption with cards like Thought-Knot Seer and Karn, the Great Creator, while also providing threat with creatures like Devourer of Destiny and Sire of Seven Deaths. The deck also has a strong finisher in Ugin, the Eye of the Storms, and All Is Dust for board wipes if needed.
